I was standing in my shoe store. The door opened and a young man came in    _  himself in a
wheelchair. I was shocked to see that he had no  _  .
"I need a new pair of    _  for
myself, a pair of black cowboy ones, "he said. I was so  _  that
I remained silent and didn't move.
"I'm not kidding, sir,    _  I don't actually need them, "he looked at me and  _  .
"When I was a kid, my parents bought me new shoes every year. It was such a(an)   _    feeling that I have never forgotten it. "I took out a pair of shoes and    _  them to the young man.
He  _  the shoes against his nose and drew in
deep breath.  _  came to his eyes. At that
moment, a homeless old man was standing outside  _  shoes,
looking at us. The young man  _  and said to me,
"Will you ask that old man to come in, please? "I did so and the poor man came
in.
"What is the    _  of
your feet? "the young man asked the poor man.
"A nine and a half."
The young man asked me to take out the best shoes of the size. He    turned to  the old man, "Sir,
would you mind  trying on  them for me? "After the shoes
were on his feet, the old man said they fit  _  .
"I'll buy them, "the young man said. "The good    _  that I have never forgotten has come
back again, and now I have someone to  _  it with

The young man    _  what
the old man needed  _  . He did his best in an
imperfect world.
